translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter about the Giver of a Support
The Elder Sovaṇṇavaṭaṁsaka
“As I was going to the park,
I saw the Leader of the World;
I took a vaṭaṁsaka leaf,
well-made, of gold.
Quickly I mounted
on the back of an elephant,
and I placed it on the Buddha,
Sikhī, the Kinsman of the World.
Thirty-one aeons ago,
the flower I placed on him;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping with flowers.
Twenty-seven aeons ago,
there was a lord of the people,
called Mahāpatāpa,
a powerful Wheel-turning Monarch.
The four analytical knowledges …
… the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā sovaṇṇavaṭaṁsakiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā sovaṇṇavaṭasakiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus the venerable Sovaṇṇavaṭaṁsaka recited these verses.
The Elder Sovaṇṇavaṭaṁsaka’s Birth Story is the seventh.
